Patriots Defensive lineman Christian Barmore Sidelined The New england Patriots announced that defensive lineman Christian Barmore will be out indefinitely. Barmore, who had been working hard to return to the field this season, is being placed on the reserve/non-football illness list. This comes after a recurrence of symptoms that require additional medical attention. Patriots Place Defensive Lineman Christian Barmore on Reserve List The new England Patriots announced that defensive lineman christian Barmore will be placed on the reserve non-football illness list. This decision comes after Barmore experienced a recurrence of symptoms that necessitate further medical evaluation. In a statement, the team emphasized their commitment to Barmore’s well-being. “We appreciate everything Christian did to return to the team this season, but our top priority is Christian’s health and wellbeing,” the statement read. “We know that he will continue to receive tremendous care and we want to ensure that he gets the time he needs to come back stronger than ever.” The statement, however, did not disclose the specific nature of Barmore’s recurring illness. “We appreciate everything Christian did to return to the team this season, but our top priority is Christian’s health and wellbeing. We know that he will continue to receive tremendous care and we want to ensure that he gets the time he needs to come back stronger than ever,” Fans and teammates alike are hoping for a swift and complete recovery for Barmore.
